title: Credit Card Payment
body: It says that credit cards are processed in Ireland and may incur international fees, is there any reason  it has changed to this?

replies.body:
Where are you seeing this message? Are you sure you're logged into the right account/region in the client? A screenshot would be super helpful as well.

I don't see anything on mine saying there has been any changes, and that sounds like it would be something that applied to EU accounts.

In the payment finalization screen. I am logged into right account and region.
[Link to Screenshot](https://i.imgur.com/QvRrHhU.png)

How very strange, I'll see if I can find some more info, likely it wouldn't cause issues often or they would find another solution, but if you're concerned you could use paypal or prepaid cards to pay instead for now. Or you could just buy $5 and see if there are any charges before buying a large sum.

I'll see what I can track down about it though.
wait did you get charged international fees though?

No. 

Still not entirely sure it what circumstance you'd ever be charged fees, but I haven't heard of it happening to anyone. Perhaps if there was currency conversion involved, or if you were using a weird bank/account that only does stuff in-country (which would be none that I've heard of).
